intro: Pelargonium barnardianum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Pelargonium barnardianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
